variables.description: Boolean if the date picker styles should be included.
Boolean if the time picker styles should be included.

Boolean if the classes to force a certain orientation should be included.
This is not set by default because it is recommended to just allow device
orientation to determine the orientation of the picker.
The z-index for inline pickers.

see.description: The default z index for fixed floating buttons
The z-index to use for fixed navigation drawers.

The z-index to use for menus
type Number
The z-index to use for snackbars.

usedBy.description:
Includes the base styles for pickers. This is styles that is used for both date and time pickers.
This is normally used within the `react-md-pickers` mixin.

variables.description: The width for the the picker while portrait.

usedBy.description:
This includes the styles that force a certain orientation. These styles are usually not
included by default because it is best to allow the device's orientation to determine
the orientation of the picker.

You can either update the `$md-pickers-include-forceful-classes` variable before using
the `react-md-everything` / `react-md-pickers` mixins, or manually use this mixin.

variables.description:
The minimal about of margin for pickers on mobile devices. This is used when placing
the picker in a dialog. The width and height can be larger than the default allowed
margin for dialogs, so this will update those margins.

mixins.description:
Includes the styles for date and time pickers. If the `$include-date` and `$include-time`
parameters are both false, no styles will be created.

context.name: react-md-pickers

parameter.name: primary-color
parameter.description: The primary color to style with.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description: Boolean if styling with the light theme.

parameter.name: include-media
parameter.description: Boolean if the media queries should be included.

parameter.name: include-date
parameter.description: Boolean if the date picker styles should be included.

parameter.name: include-time
parameter.description: Boolean if the time picker styles should be included.

parameter.name: include-forceful-classes
parameter.description:
Boolean if the
    `.md-picker--portrait` and `.md-picker--landscape` classes should be included.

usedBy.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

context.name: react-md-everything

mixins.description:
Themes the pickers with the new colors only if the `primary-color` does not equal the `md-primary-color`,
or the `light-theme` does not equal the `md-light-theme` and at least one of `include-date` or `include-time`
are true.

context.name: react-md-theme-pickers

parameter.name: primary-color
parameter.description: The primary color to style with.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description: Boolean if styling with the light theme.

parameter.name: include-date
parameter.description: Boolean if the date picker styles should be included.

parameter.name: include-time
parameter.description: Boolean if the time picker styles should be included.

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base css the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

context.name: react-md-theme-everything
